alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Grainger; Jefferson; Knox; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 11 at 6:56PM CDT until June 11 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Knox County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Anderson County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Jefferson County in east Tennessee... Western Grainger County in east Tennessee... Union County in east Tennessee... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 755 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northeast of Clinton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Clinton, Maynardville, Plainview, New Market, Blaine, Rocky Top, Norris, Luttrell, Norris Dam State Park and Andersonville. This includes Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 116 and 127. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
